alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windsor; Orange; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Orange and eastern Windsor Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 800 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Quechee, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... White River Junction, Woodstock, Hartland Four Corners, Windsor, Woodstock Village, Sharon, Quechee, Ascutney, Pomfret, Norwich, Hartland, Weathersfield, West Windsor, Hartford, Barnard, Queechee State Park, Brownsville, North Hartland Dam Recreation Area, West Woodstock, and Ascutney State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 1 and 15. Interstate 91 between mile markers 48 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
